Closing will do this automatically\n    // We need to set the position to 0 in order to read \n    // from the beginning.\n    ms.Position = 0;\n    StreamReader sr = new StreamReader(ms);\n    var myStr = sr.ReadToEnd();\n    sr.Close();\n    ms.Close();\n}"

            "title": [
              ["Reading and writing to streams can be done via "],
              ["StreamReader", [["c"]]],
              [" and "],
              ["StreamWriter", [["c"]]],
              [
                ". One should be careful when closing these. By default, closing will also close contained stream as well and make it unusable for further uses. This default behaviour can be change by using a "
              ],
              [
                "constructor",
                [
                  [
                    "a",
                    "https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/gg712952(v=vs.110).aspx"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [" which has "],
              ["bool leaveOpen", [["c"]]],
              [" parameter and setting its value as "],
              ["true", [["c"]]],
              ["."]

              [
                "FileStream fs = new FileStream(\"sample.txt\", FileMode.Create);\nStreamWriter sw = new StreamWriter(fs);\nstring NextLine = \"This is the appended line.\";\nsw.Write(NextLine);\nsw.Close();\n//fs.Close(); There is no need to close fs.
